channel.title: Closed because of a douchebag
channel.description:
Hello do you want your server to not be random numbers so people trust you?
Well send me a message and i will give you a subdomain :>
SPACES LEFT: 5 free DNS sub-domains.
<yourservername>.netoracraft.com thats what your users will connect to.
thanks ~mironic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:20, topic:444798”]…

If I update manually my client isn’t running? I don’t have it installed on my server and don’t even know if there’s a version for linux.

Offline settings are an Enhanced / No-IP Plus feature. When offline mode is enabled, the host will use whatever offline method is selected on the No-IP.com website for that host. Possible values are YES and NO with default of NO. If an update request is performed on an offline host, the host is removed from the offline state.

That’s not what you’re saying, and I’m certain you wouldn’t have a clue how to provide it to your users. I’m not replying again because you’re clearly wrong and just trying to confuse us with shit.[/quote]
your an asshole to the highest calibur. and i do know how to provide to my users… and i think you need to leave me the fuck alone.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

…

If I update manually my client isn’t running? I don’t have it installed on my server and don’t even know if there’s a version for linux.

Offline settings are an Enhanced / No-IP Plus feature. When offline mode is enabled, the host will use whatever offline method is selected on the No-IP.com website for that host. Possible values are YES and NO with default of NO. If an update request is performed on an offline host, the host is removed from the offline state.
That's not what you're saying, and I'm certain you wouldn't have a clue how to provide it to your users. I'm not replying again because you're clearly wrong and just trying to confuse us with shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:18, topic:444798”][quote author=mironic link=topic=547485.msg4017327#msg4017327 date=1339734035]

You don’t have to download anything if using NO-IP. The only reason you’d really download it if your IP was dynamic and changed a lot, and you don’t offer an instant auto updating service anyway. Not to mention this service probably won’t be available for long (in comparison to long standing services like no-ip), and your apparent 5 sub domain cap.

Why would I want your server in my domain, and risk using you when I could use no-ip with ease?

offline mode A type DNS costs about $12 a month. just saying.
[/quote]wat? no-ip is free and there are plenty of other free dynamic dns providers

your shit doesn’t allow automatic updates, and when your domain expires or you want to use some more of your available subdomains you’re just gonna take a shit on everyone. and what makes an ip untrustworthy?

also this is just advertising for your server/site, and makes it look like servers that use one of your subdomains are somehow associated.

your stupid, were not talking about the providers. were talking about offline support.
you have to pay $12 to have no-ip to run the DNS without the applicaiton running on your computer.
for most people, they care about there computer and turn it off every 6 hours.

no ip’s offer:
Online mode = running on your computer 24/7
$12/month offline mode = dont worry about the application, we will forward the ip on or offline.

my offer: dont pay $12 a month il do it for free offline and online.

hahahahahahaha that’s not what offline mode is you fucking moron

also, I still use no-ip for the home-hosted websites that I haven’t yet migrated to my cloud, and that continues to resolve to the old IP address when I get a new one. I’ve never used the no-ip application, I just update manually. At no charge![/quote]
your a fucking moron, that is exactly what offline mode is… when the duc 3.0 is offline or shutdown with $12 no-ip will continue to forward…

also if oyu update manually your no-ip duc 3.0 is still running is it not?

if you continue to run the Duc 3.0 then ofcourse its still going to redirect.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“mironic, post:9, topic:444798”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=547485.msg4015646#msg4015646 date=1339608312]

You don’t have to download anything if using NO-IP. The only reason you’d really download it if your IP was dynamic and changed a lot, and you don’t offer an instant auto updating service anyway. Not to mention this service probably won’t be available for long (in comparison to long standing services like no-ip), and your apparent 5 sub domain cap.

Why would I want your server in my domain, and risk using you when I could use no-ip with ease?

offline mode A type DNS costs about $12 a month. just saying.
[/quote]wat? no-ip is free and there are plenty of other free dynamic dns providers

your shit doesn’t allow automatic updates, and when your domain expires or you want to use some more of your available subdomains you’re just gonna take a shit on everyone. and what makes an ip untrustworthy?

also this is just advertising for your server/site, and makes it look like servers that use one of your subdomains are somehow associated.

your stupid, were not talking about the providers. were talking about offline support.
you have to pay $12 to have no-ip to run the DNS without the applicaiton running on your computer.
for most people, they care about there computer and turn it off every 6 hours.

no ip’s offer:
Online mode = running on your computer 24/7
$12/month offline mode = dont worry about the application, we will forward the ip on or offline.

my offer: dont pay $12 a month il do it for free offline and online.[/quote]
hahahahahahaha that’s not what offline mode is you fucking moron

also, I still use no-ip for the home-hosted websites that I haven’t yet migrated to my cloud, and that continues to resolve to the old IP address when I get a new one. I’ve never used the no-ip application, I just update manually. At no charge!

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

Tom:

I’m still not seeing why I’d use your service though, I still don’t understand, that’s not through lack of knowledge it’s because of your over use of ellipsis and lack of post structure. If what you’re offering is so great and saves them $12 a month then I’m sure the crowd will arrive soon to claim the limited 5 slots

i really should have posted this on a more traficy site though. because, moparcraft has like 3 people on a day, you me and AGL… and rarely kracky.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Tom, post:12, topic:444798”]Honestly, this is the second time I’ve ever debated something with you, and I’m pretty sure you win debates by deliberately confusing your opponents to a point where what you’re saying doesn’t even make sense.

How can you not be talking about no-ip? You actually said the word “no-ip” in your post. I don’t mean to be rude but I don’t think you understand every word you’re putting into your post. I have no intention of trashing your thread or anything, I just don’t understand what the point is.[/quote]
NO-IP A TYPE DNS (the dns needed to redirect ports with servers) is $12 for offlien mode… im not talking about servers on computers i wont host thoughs… im talking about 24/7 VPS servers that are constantly up… with almost no downtime…
people dont want to pay no-ip $12 a month to keep there stupid “no-ip” links up in premium mode because its expensive… its not confusing if you do your research of no-ip… the other “free” offline mode redirects are for website redirecting. i researched and tried myself…


offline mode means when Duc 3.0 is not running it will continue to redirect to the ip… its $12 a month… and its stupid…

like i saidi m offering to give them a DNS redirect without having to download any No-ip shit or pay $12 a month…

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Honestly, this is the second time I’ve ever debated something with you, and I’m pretty sure you win debates by deliberately confusing your opponents to a point where what you’re saying doesn’t even make sense.

How can you not be talking about no-ip? You actually said the word “no-ip” in your post. I don’t mean to be rude but I don’t think you understand every word you’re putting into your post. I have no intention of trashing your thread or anything, I just don’t understand what the point is.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“Tom, post:10, topic:444798”]Uh no, I don’t have the application on my computer and my no-ip still works when my PC is offline, I know that for a fact because I recently hosted the hunger games using it. So I ask again, why would I use your service?

Even if what you’re saying was true, pretty much everybody is going to host the no-ip application on the same machine that the MC server is hosted on (to take advantage of the auto updating if the IP is dynamic too). So, if the no-ip application wasn’t running the MC server wouldn’t be either therefore you’re achieving the same thing (no server to connect to).[/quote]im not talking about people with no-ip on there computer and minecraft… im talking about the people who have a vps, but dont want to buy a website or pay 12$ a month.

Read full topic

item.title: Closed because of a douchebag
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Uh no, I don’t have the application on my computer and my no-ip still works when my PC is offline, I know that for a fact because I recently hosted the hunger games using it. So I ask again, why would I use your service?

Even if what you’re saying was true, pretty much everybody is going to host the no-ip application on the same machine that the MC server is hosted on (to take advantage of the auto updating if the IP is dynamic too). So, if the no-ip application wasn’t running the MC server wouldn’t be either therefore you’re achieving the same thing (no server to connect to).

Read full topic
